channel.title: Free Starter Template
channel.description:
If you are new to web design (or even if you aren't new), below is a little template that I use on a lot of my websites. It is basic and can be modified in just about any way. This is to basically make it so that you don't have to start over from scratch on every site that you make. There are no requirements, but the current way that it is set up, you will need a css. To make one, just go into notepad and add something like the below, and save it as "something.css"... make sure that you keep the ".css" part. [code]body { color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF; } #banner area { border: 1px solid #000000; } #links area { border: 1px solid #000000; } #content area { border: 1px solid #000000; }[/code] Now for the real code. Just open notepad, copy & paste, then after you edit it, save it as "something.php" (it doesn't have to be ".php"... it could be ".html" or ".htm" as well. [code] Your Site Name Here
Link 1 Link 2
Content goes here... Blah blah blah...
[/code] [b]Note:[/b] Do not try to ONLY use this template. It NEEDS editing. Without editing, it looks awful. [b]Note2:[/b] Just a little piece of info... this is using xHTML Transitional at the moment. You may change it if you wish. Enjoy, -Alexia

item.description:
@I_Really_Did_Lol wrote:

[quote=“alexia, post:8, topic:39854”]Are you retarded? It looks like nothing. It is a BLANK template to save time and/or help out the newer people to web design. FFS. I have said that 3 times already.

-Alexia[/quote]

Thanks <3

I needed something like this. Just so I can experiment with some shit.

I would say thank you if I could get on my CM account xD

Thanks again.

item.title: Free Starter Template
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

If you are new to web design (or even if you aren’t new), below is a little template that I use on a lot of my websites. It is basic and can be modified in just about any way. This is to basically make it so that you don’t have to start over from scratch on every site that you make.

There are no requirements, but the current way that it is set up, you will need a css. To make one, just go into notepad and add something like the below, and save it as “something.css”… make sure that you keep the “.css” part.

body { color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF; } #banner area { border: 1px solid #000000; } #links area { border: 1px solid #000000; } #content area { border: 1px solid #000000; }

Now for the real code. Just open notepad, copy & paste, then after you edit it, save it as “something.php” (it doesn’t have to be “.php”… it could be “.html” or “.htm” as well.

[code]

Your Site Name Here
Link 1 Link 2
Content goes here... Blah blah blah...
[/code]

Note: Do not try to ONLY use this template. It NEEDS editing. Without editing, it looks awful.

Note2: Just a little piece of info… this is using xHTML Transitional at the moment. You may change it if you wish.

Enjoy,
-Alexia

Read full topic
